title: Case Study: Spastic Diplegic Cerebral Palsy in a Pediatric Patient
clinical_history: Jacob is an 8-year-old male referred to the clinic by his pediatrician for assessment and ongoing management of spastic diplegic cerebral palsy. He was born prematurely at 31 weeks gestation via C-section due to maternal pre-eclampsia. Initial NICU stay of 5 weeks; neonatal course complicated by mild intraventricular hemorrhage. Parents report delayed motor milestones: sitting unsupported at 15 months, walking at 3 years with a walker. Currently ambulates short distances indoors with a posterior walker, exhibiting pronounced bilateral lower limb spasticity, scissoring gait, and toe-walking. He experiences muscular tightness and pain, notably in the hamstrings and gastrocnemius, especially during physical activity and rapid growth spurts, impacting participation in PE and outdoor play.
